are irritating to eyes and skin.

nE9ymH9o.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Normally atmospheric pressure stops falling rapidly behind a warm front, the air temperature rises.

Cumulus clouds and a good visibility are normally observed in a warm sector in autumn.

38IajRbu.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

W92F3vwF.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text:
Differences training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge and training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.
Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.

Differences training requires the acquisition of additional training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.
Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.
Differences training and familiarisation training are both the same.

Differences training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge.
Familiarisation training requires the acquisition of additional knowledge and training on an appropriate training device or the aircraft.

EoE3d2sR.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text:
FG is reported only when visibility is reduced by water
droplets or ice crystals to less than 1000 m

When BR is reported then the visibility is more than 1000
m but less than 8000 m

VC denotes not at the aerodrome but within 8
NM

HZ is reported only when visibility is reduced to 2000 m
or less

8LcRTAAw.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Airframe icing can occur in clear air
Haze is a reduction of visibility due to the presence of water vapour
Mountain waves are always accompanied by rotor clouds
Above the tropopause no turbulence occurs

XLORb7Rx.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: V~R~ is the speed at which the pilot should start to rotate the aeroplane.
V~R~ is the speed at which, during rotation, the nose wheel comes off the runway.
V~R~ should not be higher than 1.05 V~MCG~.
V~R~ should not be higher than V~1~.

u3RPuiKk.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The diurnal range of temperature is least in tropical countries.
The diurnal variation of temperature is greatest when a moderate wind is blowing.
The diurnal range of temperature sees the lowest temperature at sunrise.
The diurnal range of temperature is greatest in conditions of high humidity.

Ub7gkiiQ.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: FG is reported only when visibility is reduced by water droplets or ice crystals to less than 1 000 m.
When BR is reported then the visibility is more than 1 000 m but less than 8 000 m.
VC denotes not at the aerodrome but within 8 NM.
HZ is reported only when visibility is reduced to 2 000 m or less.

wUUO59Cs.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The climb limited Take-off Mass is independent of the wind component.
The take-off distance with one engine out is independent of the wind component.
The performance limited Take-off Mass is independent of the wind component.
The accelerate stop distance required is independent of the runway condition.

ze01xN1f.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A stopway means an area beyond the take-off runway, able to support the aeroplane during an abandoned take-off.
If a clearway or a stopway is used, the liftoff point must be attainable at least at the end of the permanent runway surface.
A clearway is an area beyond the runway which can be used for an aborted take-off.
An underrun is an area beyond the runway end which can be used for an aborted take-off.

gHPyal83.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The Bergeron-Findeisen process is mainly based on the difference of maximum vapour pressure over water and over ice of the same temperature
The principle of the Bergeron-Findeisen process is mainly based on the difference in size of the cloud elements
In the tropics stratiform precipitation does not occur
At mid-latitudes the coalescense process is usually the initial process in the formation of precipitation

pKJ5kjrU.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Short-term memory is affected by interruptions.
All motivators (both physcial and mental) are subjective.
Extreme "achievement" motivation in a Captain is an ideal attribute for a Captain of an aircraft.
Motivation does not affect performance.

4UPejDD9.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Non rotating wheels have lower aquaplaning speeds.
Rotating wheels have lower aquaplaning speeds.
Non rotating wheels have higher aquaplaning speeds.
Rotating and non rotating wheels will aquaplane at the same speed.

cX48t14O.question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.text: Concrete has a lower specific heat than grass.
Large land masses have greater seasonal temperature changes than islands.
Large land masses have greater diurnal temperature changes than islands.
The SI unit of heat capacity is joule per kelvin.

19lvxBcf.question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.text: Stress has essentially negative effects on a pilot and he/she will operate efficiently in the absence of it.
The initial effects of carbon monoxide poisoning are not immediately alarming.
Human conflict tends to escalate.
Behaviour is generally the outcome of personality and attitude.

AaGNN4Q0.question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.text:
Extra fuel can only be carried at the discretion of the
Operations Officer

You should always land with Final Reserve Fuel
intact

Reserve Fuel consists of the sum of: (Contingency +
Alternate + Final Reserve + Additional) Fuels

Alternate Fuel is the fuel required from the missed
approach point at destination to the runway of the nominated
alternate aerodrome

TTrerLBA.question: In a hydraulic brake system of a transport aircraft, an accumulator is pre-charged to 1 200 psi. If an electrically driven hydraulic pump is started and provides a system pressure of 3 000 psi, the pressure gauge, which is connected to the gas section of the accumulator, will read:

options.text: 3 000 psi
1 200 psi
1 800 psi
4 200 psi

vHJMupRC.question: In flight, the cabin air for large jet transport aeroplanes is usually supplied by ..

options.text: engine compressors.
ram air intakes.
single radial compressors.
piston compressors.

GOe3jpZ3.question: On most large aeroplanes, the type of low-pressure fuel pump is..

options.text: centrifugal.
piston.
gear.
diaphragm.

vPJDvA9s.question: Some turbine-engined aeroplanes are fitted with trim tanks. Where are these normally placed and what is their purpose?

options.text: They are placed in the tail of the aeroplane, and their function is to control the CG location during flight.
They are placed in the nose of the aeroplanes, and their function is to control pitch attitudes during approach.
They are placed in the fuselage close to the CG of the aeroplane, and their function is to extend its range.
They are placed in the wing tips , and their function is to assist with the lateral stability of the aeroplane.

FYvRWUIm.question: The operating pressure of a booster pump in the fuel supply system of a gas turbine aircraft is typically within the following range:

options.text: 20 to 100 psi
300 to 500 psi
5 to 10 psi

54ONbogv.question: Which type of electric power supplies the low pressure pumps of the fuel system on most transport jet aeroplanes?

options.text: 115 V AC
28 V AC
28 V DC
115 V DC

IPFL9pWI.question: On most transport aeroplanes, the low pressure pumps of the fuel system are

options.text: electrically driven centrifugal pumps.
electro-mechanical swash plate pumps, with self-regulated pressure.
hydraulically driven centrifugal pumps.
mechanically driven by the engine`s accessory gearbox.

n4wb8LeV.question:
Prior to starting a reciprocating engine at sea level the manifold pressure gauge usually indicates approximately 29 inch Hg
 This is because the

options.text: pressure in the manifold is the same as atmospheric pressure.
throttle is closed, trapping high pressure in the manifold.
throttle is in the full-open position.
pointer on the gauge is stuck at the full-power indication.

1Z6oGlkE.question: The auxiliary fuel pumps installed on single-engine low-wing aeroplanes are typically used: - during take-off. - during cruise. - during landing. - in emergency situations. - in case of a suspected vapour lock. - in case of failure of the engine fuel pump.

mztJd2yu.question: You can find the low pressure (LP) compressor between the stations

options.text: 2.5 and 3
6 and 7
3 and 4
7 and 8

1VQaHiLg.question: You can find the low pressure (LP) turbine between the stations

options.text: 6 and 7
2.5 and 3
3 and 4
2 and 2.5

MhhKFkRs.question: Which of these statements about fire-extinguishing agents are correct or incorrect? - I. The fire extinguishing effect of Halon is mainly based on cooling when the agent exhausts via a venturi during discharge. - II. Halon should be used with caution because it is highly corrosive particularly for aluminium alloys.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
